p: “Although the last reported cases of urban transmission in Brazil occurred in 1942, in 2016–2017, the country faced major outbreaks of the disease mainly in the states of Minas Gerais, Espírito Santo and Rio de Janeiro. In 2018, the epidemic also extended to São Paulo State 9 . According to the Brazilian Ministry of Health, from July 2017 to April 2018, there were 1,127 YFV cases with 328 deaths, with no evidence of urban transmission.”
